JoiningSystemEventContent.description: JoiningSystemEventContent is the common payload of the event from a joining system.

JoiningSystemEventContent_AssociatedEnti.description: AssociatedEntities is a list of identifiers of various entities/objects available in the given system. Example: An event maybe associated to Asset, Result, Joint, Error, etc.

items.title: EntityDataType
items.description: This structure provides the identification data for a given entity in the system.

Name.description: It is the name of the entity identifier.  Examples: VIN, Program Id, etc.  Note: Application can send custom names which could be a combination of different terms in the system.

Description.description: It is the description of the entity. Any additional information for the entity can be sent using this property.   Examples: Name of the program in the given system.

EntityId.description: It is the identifier of the given entity.   Examples: JoiningProcessId, JointId, etc.

EntityOriginId.description: It is the origin identifier of the given entity. It is provided only when it is applicable and available for a given entity.  Examples: JoiningProcessOriginId, JointOriginId, etc.

IsExternal.description: It indicates if the EntityId is provided by the external system or not.   Example: VIN is provided by an external system.

EntityType.description: It provides the type of the Entity. It has the following pre-defined values which shall be used for each instance of this type.  Important Note: EntityType >=0 is defined as part of this specification.  For application specific extensions, EntityType < 0 can be used.

JoiningSystemEventContent_EventCode.description: EventCode is a system specific event code associated to the given event.

JoiningSystemEventContent_EventText.description: EventText is a human readable text related to the context of the event.

JoiningSystemEventContent_JoiningTechnol.description: JoiningTechnology is a human readable text to identify the joining technology which has triggered the event. Examples: Tightening, Gluing, Riveting, Flow Drill Fastening, etc.

JoiningSystemEventContent_ReportedValues.description: ReportedValues is a list of values associated with the given event payload. Example: If it is an over temperature event, then the ReportedValue can be the measured value along with the corresponding limits.

items.title: ReportedValueDataType
items.description: This structure provides the given value and corresponding limits for a given physical quantity (if applicable).

PhysicalQuantity.description: It is the physical quantity of the value. Example: Torque, Angle, etc.   Note: It may not be applicable for few reported values such as Software Version, etc.

Name.description: It is the name of the given value.

CurrentValue.description: It is the current value. The data type can be any simple data type such as Integer, String, Double, DateTime, etc. If the value is corresponding to the physical quantity, then the recommended data type is Double.

PreviousValue.description: It is the previous value (if available). The data type can be any simple data type such as Integer, String, Double, DateTime, etc. If the value is corresponding to the physical quantity, then the data type should be Double.

LowLimit.description: It is the low limit of the given value. It is not applicable for values which do not have PhysicalQuantity.

HighLimit.description: It is the high limit of the given value. It is not applicable for values which do not have PhysicalQuantity.

EngineeringUnits.title: EUInformation
EngineeringUnits.description: It is the engineering unit of the CurrentValue, PreviousValue, LowLimit, HighLimit.  It is not applicable for values which does not have PhysicalQuantity.

ResultEvaluationEnum.description: Indicates whether a result was in tolerance

Undefined.description: The evaluation of the result is unknown, for example because it failed

NotOK.description: The result is out of tolerance

NotDecidable.description: The decision is not possible due to measurement uncertainty.

Result.title: ResultDataType
Result.description: Contains fields that were created during the execution of a recipe.

ResultMetaData.title: ResultMetaDataType
ResultMetaData.description: Meta data of a result, describing the result.

ResultId.description: System-wide unique identifier, which is assigned by the system. This ID can be used for fetching exactly this result using the method GetResultById and it is identical to the ResultId of the ResultReadyEventType.  If the system does not manage resultIds, it should always be set to NA.

HasTransferableDataOnFile.description: Indicates that additional data for this result can be retrieved by temporary file transfer.  If not provided, it is assumed that no file is available.

IsPartial.description: Indicates whether the result is the partial result of a total result. When not all samples are finished yet the result is 'partial'.  If not provided, it is assumed to be a total result.

IsSimulated.description: Indicates whether the result was created in simulation mode.  Simulation mode implies that the result is only generated for testing purposes and not based on real production data.  If not provided, it is assumed to not be simulated.

ResultState.description: ResultState provides information about the current state of the process or measurement creating a result.  Applications may use negative values for application-specific states. All other values shall only be used as defined in the following:  0  Undefined initial value  1  Completed: Processing was carried out completely  2  Processing: Processing has not been finished yet  3  Aborted: Processing was stopped at some point before completion  4  Failed: Processing failed in some way

StepId.description: Identifies the step which produced the result.  Although the system-wide unique JobId would be sufficient to identify the job which the result belongs to, this makes for easier filtering without keeping track of JobIds.  This specification does not define how the stepId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client when starting an execution.

PartId.description: Identifies the part used to produce the result.  Although the system-wide unique JobId would be sufficient to identify the job which the result belongs to, this makes for easier filtering without keeping track of JobIds.  This specification does not define how the partId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client when starting the job.

ExternalRecipeId.description: External ID of the recipe in use which produced the result. The External ID is managed by the environment.  This specification does not define how the externalRecipeId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client.

InternalRecipeId.description: Internal ID of the recipe in use which produced the result. This ID is system-wide unique and it is assigned by the system.

ProductId.description: Identifies the product used to produce the result.  This specification does not define how the externalRecipeId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client.

ExternalConfigurationId.description: External ID of the Configuration in use while the result was produced.  It is managed by the Environment.  This specification does not define how the externalConfigurationId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client.

InternalConfigurationId.description: Internal ID of the Configuration in use while the result was produced. This ID is system-wide unique and it is assigned by the system.

JobId.description: Identifies the job which produced the result.  This ID is system-wide unique and it is assigned by the system.

CreationTime.description: CreationTime indicates the time when the result was created. Creation time on the measurement system (not the receive time of the server).  It is recommended to always provide the creationTime.

ProcessingTimes.title: ProcessingTimesDataType
ProcessingTimes.description: Contains measured times that were generated during the execution of a recipe.

StartTime.description: Contains the time when the system started execution of the recipe.

EndTime.description: Contains the time when the system finished (or stopped/aborted) execution of the recipe.

AcquisitionDuration.description: Time spent by the system acquiring data.

ProcessingDuration.description: Time spent by the system processing data.

ResultUri.description: Path to the actual measured result, managed external to the server.

ResultEvaluation.title: ResultEvaluationEnum
ResultEvaluation.description: The ResultEvaluation indicates whether the result was in tolerance.

ResultEvaluationCode.description: Vendor-specific code describing more details on resultEvaluation.

ResultEvaluationDetails.description: The optional EvaluationDetails provides high level status information in a user-friendly text. This can be left empty for successful operations.

FileFormat.description: The format in which the measurement results are available (e.g. QDAS, CSV, ) using the ResultTransfer Object. If multiple file formats are provided, the GenerateFileForRead of ResultTransfer should contain corresponding transferOptions, to select the file format. This specification does not define those transferOptions.

ResultContent.description: Abstract data type to be subtyped from to hold result data created by the selected recipe.

items.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

items.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

Description.description: Description is the system specific description of the asset.

JoiningTechnology.description: JoiningTechnology is a human readable text to identify the joining technology.

SupplierCode.description: SupplierCode is the SAP or ERP Supplier Code of the asset.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

Description.description: It is the description of the system which could be written by the customer to identify the system. It could be the purpose of the system in the assembly line.

IntegratorName.description: IntegratorName is the name of the system integrator.

JoiningTechnology.description: JoiningTechnology is a human readable text to identify the joining technology of the joining system.

Location.description: Location is the location of the given system in the given plant or factory in text format.

Manufacturer.description: Manufacturer provides a human-readable, localized name of the joining system manufacturer.

ManufacturerUri.description: ManufacturerUri provides a unique identifier for this company. This identifier should be a fully qualified domain name; however, it may be a GUID or similar construct that ensures global uniqueness.

Model.description: Model provides the type of the joining system. Examples: Fixtured System, Handheld System, etc.

Name.description: Name is the name of the joining system. It can also be the standard browse name of the instance of JoiningSystemType.

ProductInstanceUri.description: ProductInstanceUri is a globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer.

SystemId.description: SystemId is the system integrator specific identifier for the system. It represents a reference to the manufacturer ERP system.

AbortJoiningProcess.description: The Method AbortJoiningProcess is used to abort the input joining process if it is under execution.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

JoiningProcessIdentification.title: JoiningProcessIdentificationDataType
JoiningProcessIdentification.description: This structure contains the identification information of a Joining Process. It is used in set of methods defined in JoiningProcessManagementType.

JoiningProcessId.description: It is the system-wide unique identifier of the joining process.

JoiningProcessOriginId.description: It is an identifier to track the changes made to the original instance in the system.    Example: It can point to the identifier of the object when it was created for the first time. It should be an existing ID in the system if it is available else it can be NULL if it is not tracked in the system.

SelectionName.description: It is the configured selection name of the joining process in the system.

AbortMessage.description: It is an optional message sent from the Client to the joining system to indicate the reason for aborting the joining operation.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DecrementJoiningProcessCounter.description: The Method DecrementJoiningProcessCounter used to decrement the counter of the sequential joining processes such as Job, etc.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

JoiningProcessIdentification.title: JoiningProcessIdentificationDataType
JoiningProcessIdentification.description: This structure contains the identification information of a Joining Process. It is used in set of methods defined in JoiningProcessManagementType.

JoiningProcessId.description: It is the system-wide unique identifier of the joining process.

JoiningProcessOriginId.description: It is an identifier to track the changes made to the original instance in the system.    Example: It can point to the identifier of the object when it was created for the first time. It should be an existing ID in the system if it is available else it can be NULL if it is not tracked in the system.

SelectionName.description: It is the configured selection name of the joining process in the system.

DecrementCount.description: It is the number of decrements to be done for the joining process counter.  The default value is 1 if it is not provided.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DeleteJoiningProcess.description: The Method DeleteJoiningProcess is used to delete the input joining process.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

JoiningProcessIdentification.title: JoiningProcessIdentificationDataType
JoiningProcessIdentification.description: This structure contains the identification information of a Joining Process. It is used in set of methods defined in JoiningProcessManagementType.

JoiningProcessId.description: It is the system-wide unique identifier of the joining process.

JoiningProcessOriginId.description: It is an identifier to track the changes made to the original instance in the system.    Example: It can point to the identifier of the object when it was created for the first time. It should be an existing ID in the system if it is available else it can be NULL if it is not tracked in the system.

SelectionName.description: It is the configured selection name of the joining process in the system.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DeselectJoiningProcess.description: The Method DeselectJoiningProcess is used to deselect any selected joining process.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

GetJoiningProcess.description: The Method GetJoiningProcess is used to get the joining process based on the input identifier.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

JoiningProcessId.description: It is the identifier of the joining process.

JoiningProcess.title: JoiningProcessDataType
JoiningProcess.description: This structure provides the base container for any joining process in a joining system.   Note: This specification defines the meta data of a JoiningProcess, and the actual content of the Joining Process is application specific.

JoiningProcessMetaData.title: JoiningProcessMetaDataType
JoiningProcessMetaData.description: This structure provides the meta data which describes the joining process.

JoiningProcessId.description: It is the system-wide unique identifier of the joining process.

JoiningProcessOriginId.description: It is an identifier to track the changes made to the original instance in the system.  Example: It can point to the identifier of the object when it was created for the first time. It should be an existing ID in the system if it is available else it can be NULL if it is not tracked in a joining system.

CreationTime.description: It is the time when the joining process was created.

LastUpdatedTime.description: It is the time when the joining process was updated last time. If it is not available, it can be same as CreationTime.

Name.description: It is the name of the joining process.

Description.description: It is the description of the joining process.

JoiningTechnology.description: It is a human readable text to identify the joining technology.

Classification.description: It is the classification of the joining process.

AssociatedEntities.description: It is the list of entities associated to the joining process.  Examples: ProductInstanceUri of the Controller.

items.title: EntityDataType
items.description: This structure provides the identification data for a given entity in the system.

Name.description: It is the name of the entity identifier.  Examples: VIN, Program Id, etc.  Note: Application can send custom names which could be a combination of different terms in the system.

Description.description: It is the description of the entity. Any additional information for the entity can be sent using this property.   Examples: Name of the program in the given system.

EntityId.description: It is the identifier of the given entity.   Examples: JoiningProcessId, JointId, etc.

EntityOriginId.description: It is the origin identifier of the given entity. It is provided only when it is applicable and available for a given entity.  Examples: JoiningProcessOriginId, JointOriginId, etc.

IsExternal.description: It indicates if the EntityId is provided by the external system or not.   Example: VIN is provided by an external system.

EntityType.description: It provides the type of the Entity. It has the following pre-defined values which shall be used for each instance of this type.  Important Note: EntityType >=0 is defined as part of this specification.  For application specific extensions, EntityType < 0 can be used.

JoiningProcessContent.description: It is the actual content of the joining process which is defined by JoiningProcessMetaData.Classification property.  Examples: Joining Program, Joining Job, etc.  Note: The content is application-specific and is not defined in this version of the specification.

items.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

SelectionName.description: It is the selection name of the joining process configured in the system.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

GetJoiningProcessList.description: The Method GetJoiningProcessList is used to get the list of joining process meta data available in the system.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

items.title: JoiningProcessMetaDataType
items.description: This structure provides the meta data which describes the joining process.

JoiningProcessId.description: It is the system-wide unique identifier of the joining process.

JoiningProcessOriginId.description: It is an identifier to track the changes made to the original instance in the system.  Example: It can point to the identifier of the object when it was created for the first time. It should be an existing ID in the system if it is available else it can be NULL if it is not tracked in a joining system.

CreationTime.description: It is the time when the joining process was created.

LastUpdatedTime.description: It is the time when the joining process was updated last time. If it is not available, it can be same as CreationTime.

Name.description: It is the name of the joining process.

Description.description: It is the description of the joining process.

JoiningTechnology.description: It is a human readable text to identify the joining technology.

Classification.description: It is the classification of the joining process.

AssociatedEntities.description: It is the list of entities associated to the joining process.  Examples: ProductInstanceUri of the Controller.

Description.description: It is the description of the entity. Any additional information for the entity can be sent using this property.   Examples: Name of the program in the given system.

EntityId.description: It is the identifier of the given entity.   Examples: JoiningProcessId, JointId, etc.

EntityOriginId.description: It is the origin identifier of the given entity. It is provided only when it is applicable and available for a given entity.  Examples: JoiningProcessOriginId, JointOriginId, etc.

IsExternal.description: It indicates if the EntityId is provided by the external system or not.   Example: VIN is provided by an external system.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StartSelectedJoining.description: The Method StartSelectedJoining is used to start the selected joining. The joining operation can be selected using SelectJoiningProcess or SelectJoint.   Note: It is not intended to be used in a hard real-time use case.

It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

DeselectAfterJoining.description: If True, it will deselect the existing joining process after the joining operation is completed. The default value is False.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

DisconnectAsset.description: The Method DisconnectAsset is used to disconnect or connect the asset.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

Disconnect.description: If true, it will prepare the asset for disconnect. The default value is false.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

EnableAsset.description: The Method EnableAsset is used to Enable or Disable a given asset. It is mostly applicable for Tool.  The joining system can report a respective event when an asset is enabled or disabled.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

Enable.description: If true, it will enable the asset, else it will disable the asset. The default value is false.  Note: If the asset is performing the joining operation when the method is executed, then it shall disable the asset after the current operation.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

ExecuteOperation.description: The Method ExecuteOperation is an application specific interface to execute any generic operations supported by a joining system.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

OperationType.description: It is the type of operation. The list of integer values corresponding to a specific operation is provided by the documentation or the joining system via some interface.

OperationText.description: It is the optional text to provide information on the type of operation.

VendorName.description: It is the optional vendors name provided to identify the type of operations supported.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

GetErrorInformation.description: The Method GetErrorInformation is used to get the error information based on the input identifier. The details returned from the joining system is application specific.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

ErrorId.description: It is the identifier of the error. It could be available as part of the JoiningResult.  Note: If it is empty, the Server is allowed to return the latest error available.

ErrorContent.description: It is the detailed error information.  Examples: Log file, Detailed Error Information or Event Logs, etc.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

GetFeedbackFileList.description: The Method GetFeedbackFileList is used to get the list of feedback files from the asset.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

FeedbackFileList.description: It is the list of feedback files available in the system. It contains the feedback filenames or the file paths which can be used as an input in SendFeedback method.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

GetIdentifiers.description: The Method GetIdentifiers is used to get the list of identifiers available in the system which were managed by external systems.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

IdentifierNames.description: The list of names of the identifiers which are requested. If it is empty, then all available identifiers are returned.

EntityList.description: It is the list of identifiers available in the joining system based on the input criteria.

GetIOSignals.description: The Method GetIOSignals is used to get the list of available signals from the asset.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

SignalIdList.description: It is the list of signal identifiers requested. If it is empty, then all the available signals are returned from the asset.

SignalList.description: It is the list of signals which are available in the asset based on the input signalIdList.   If the signalIdList is empty, then all the available signals are sent from the asset.

items.title: SignalDataType
items.description: This structure contains the signal information which is used in SetIOSignals and GetIOSignals methods.

SignalId.description: It is the identifier of the signal.

SignalValue.description: It is the value of the signal.

SignalDescription.description: It is the description of the signal.

SignalType.description: It is the type of the signal.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

RebootAsset.description: The Method RebootAsset is used to reboot an asset.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

ResetIdentifiers.description: The Method ResetIdentifiers is used to reset the specified identifiers.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

IdentifierList.description: It is the list of names of the identifiers which are requested to be reset.   If it is NOT empty, then resetAll and resetLatest flags are ignored.  If it is empty, then the resetAll or resetLatest flag is used.

ResetAll.description: If True, it will reset all the identifiers available in the joining system and resetLatest flag is ignored.  If False and identifierList is empty then the resetLatest flag is used.

ResetLatest.description: If True, it will reset the latest identifier available in the system.  Note: This is provided for supporting legacy systems. The criteria to determine which identifier is latest is application specific.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SendFeedback.description: The Method SendFeedback is used to send any type of feedback to a given asset. The feedback can be a text input or other types of feedback supported by the asset.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

FeedbackType.description: It is the type of feedback and has the following pre-defined values:  0  UNDEFINED  1  OTHER  2  TEXT  3  VISUAL  4  AUDIO  5  VIBRATE

FeedbackText.description: It is the text feedback if the feedbackType is TEXT.

FeedbackFile.description: It is the file available in the asset which needs to be run for different types of feedback such as AUDIO, VIBRATE, etc. This can be retrieved using the GetFeedbackFileList method.  It is optional and not applicable for text feedback.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SendIdentifiers.description: The Method SendIdentifiers is used to send one or more identifiers to the joining system.  These identifiers can be used for selection of a joining process, etc.  These identifiers can often be part of the generated result.   The input argument to this method is an array of EntityDataType structure where every entity in the joining system can be associated to a specific type for filtering.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

EntityList.description: It is the list of identifiers sent to the joining system.

items.title: EntityDataType
items.description: This structure provides the identification data for a given entity in the system.

Name.description: It is the name of the entity identifier.  Examples: VIN, Program Id, etc.  Note: Application can send custom names which could be a combination of different terms in the system.

Description.description: It is the description of the entity. Any additional information for the entity can be sent using this property.   Examples: Name of the program in the given system.

EntityId.description: It is the identifier of the given entity.   Examples: JoiningProcessId, JointId, etc.

EntityOriginId.description: It is the origin identifier of the given entity. It is provided only when it is applicable and available for a given entity.  Examples: JoiningProcessOriginId, JointOriginId, etc.

IsExternal.description: It indicates if the EntityId is provided by the external system or not.   Example: VIN is provided by an external system.

EntityType.description: It provides the type of the Entity. It has the following pre-defined values which shall be used for each instance of this type.  Important Note: EntityType >=0 is defined as part of this specification.  For application specific extensions, EntityType < 0 can be used.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SendTextIdentifiers.description: The Method SendTextIdentifiers is used to send one or more identifiers to a joining system.   These identifiers can be used for selection of a joining process, etc.  These identifiers can often be part of the generated result.   Note: The decision on which set of identifiers are used for the selection of a joining process and which set of identifiers should be part of the generated result is application specific.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

IdentifierList.description: It is the list of identifiers sent to the joining system.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SetCalibration.description: The Method SetCalibration is used to set the calibration information of a given asset.   It is intended to set the basic calibration information and does not cover the certification process.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

CalibrationData.title: CalibrationDataType
CalibrationData.description: This structure contains the Calibration information. It is used as an input argument in SetCalibration method.  Note: The input data sent in SetCalibration shall be updated in the respective parameters of the asset under Maintenance/Calibration.

LastCalibration.description: It is the date when the last calibration took place.  Note: It can have the initial operation date for a new asset if it is not available.

CalibrationPlace.description: It is the location where the last calibration took place.

NextCalibration.description: It is the date of the next planned calibration.

CalibrationValue.description: It is the actual measured value of the calibration.

SensorScale.description: It is the nominal scale of the sensor. It corresponds also with the measurement range of the sensor.

CertificateUri.description: It contains the URI of a certificate of the calibration target in case the calibration target is certified and the information available. Otherwise, the Variable should be omitted. The String shall be a URI as defined by RFC 3986.   Example: MCE test document.

EngineeringUnits.title: EUInformation
EngineeringUnits.description: It defines the engineering unit of the value.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SetIOSignals.description: The Method SetIOSignals is used to set a list of IO signals of the asset. The type of operations mapped to each signal is application specific.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

SignalList.description: It is the list of signals which needs to be set in the asset.

items.title: SignalDataType
items.description: This structure contains the signal information which is used in SetIOSignals and GetIOSignals methods.

SignalId.description: It is the identifier of the signal.

SignalValue.description: It is the value of the signal.

SignalDescription.description: It is the description of the signal.

SignalType.description: It is the type of the signal.

SignalStatusList.description: It is the list of status for each signal.  0  OK  Values > 0 are reserved for errors defined by this and future standards.  Values < 0 shall be used for application-specific errors.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SetOfflineTimer.description: The Method SetOfflineTimer is used to set the offline timer for the asset to determine how long the asset can perform the joining operations in an offline mode.   Note: If an asset performs the joining operation in offline mode after setting the offline timer, the corresponding results generated shall have the IsGeneratedOffline flag set to TRUE.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

OfflineTimer.description: It is the offlineTimer to be set. The behaviour of the asset when the timer is elapsed is application specific.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

SetTime.description: The Method SetTime is used to set the time of the asset manually. It is recommended to be used only when an asset does not have automated time synchronization.  The joining system can report a respective event when the time is configured manually using this method.

ProductInstanceUri.description: With this argument the Client can provide the identifier of the asset on which this method is applicable.  It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

InputTime.description: It is the input time to be configured in the asset.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

DeleteJoint.description: The Method DeleteJoint is used to delete the joint based on the input identifier.

It can be empty if the method is modelled directly under the required asset. If it is empty, the system can consider the identifier of the asset where the Server is running.

JointId.description: It is the identifier of the joint.

JointOriginId.description: With this argument the Client can provide the common identifier of the joint which should be selected for performing the next joining operation.    It is optional and can be empty if the underlying system does not manage revisions of a joint. If jointId is provided, then this argument shall be ignored.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DeleteJointComponent.description: The Method DeleteJointComponent is used to delete the joint component based on the input identifier.

JointDesignId.description: It is the identifier of the joint design.

GetJoint.description: The Method GetJoint is used to get the joint based on the input identifier.

Joint.title: JointDataType
Joint.description: This structure provides the joint information. Joint is the physical outcome of the joining operation which determines the properties of the point where multiple parts are assembled.

JointId.description: It is the identifier of the joint.

JointOriginId.description: It is an identifier to track the changes made to the original instance in the system.    Example: It can point to the identifier of the object when it was created for the first time. It should be an existing ID in the system if it is available else it can be NULL if it is not tracked in a joining system.

JointDesignId.description: It is the identifier of the associated joint design.

CreationTime.description: It is the time when the joint was created.

LastUpdatedTime.description: It is the time when the joint was updated last time. If it is not available, it can be same as CreationTime.

Name.description: It is the name of the joint.

Description.description: It is the description of the joint.

Classification.description: It is the classification of the joint.

ClassificationDetails.description: It is the details of the classification. It can also be used to provide any other type of classification.    Examples: Safety Critical, etc.

JointStatus.description: It is the status of the joint.  Examples: Ok, InUse, NotInUse, NotYetDone, etc.

AssociatedEntities.description: It is the list of entities associated to the joint.  Examples: JoiningProcessId, JobId, QualityProcessId, SimulationProcessId, etc.

JointDesignId.description: It is the identifier of the joint design.

Name.description: It is the name of the joint design.

Description.description: It is the description of the joint design.

JointDesignContent.description: It is the list of design values.

items.title: DesignValueDataType
items.description: This structure provides the design value for a given physical quantity. It is used in JointDesignDataType.

PhysicalQuantity.description: It is the physical quantity of the value. Example: Force, Angle, etc.

Name.description: It is the name of the given value.

DesignValue.description: It is the design value. The data type can be any simple data type such as Integer, String, Double, DateTime, etc. If the value is corresponding to the physical quantity, then the data type should be Double.

EngineeringUnits.title: EUInformation
EngineeringUnits.description: It is the engineering unit of the design value.

JointComponentIdList.description: It is the list of joint components associated to the joint design.  Examples: BoltId, RivetId, GasketId, etc.

items.title: DesignValueDataType
items.description: This structure provides the design value for a given physical quantity. It is used in JointDesignDataType.

PhysicalQuantity.description: It is the physical quantity of the value. Example: Force, Angle, etc.

Name.description: It is the name of the given value.

DesignValue.description: It is the design value. The data type can be any simple data type such as Integer, String, Double, DateTime, etc. If the value is corresponding to the physical quantity, then the data type should be Double.

EngineeringUnits.title: EUInformation
EngineeringUnits.description: It is the engineering unit of the design value.

JointComponentIdList.description: It is the list of joint components associated to the joint design.  Examples: BoltId, RivetId, GasketId, etc.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

FromSequenceNumber.description: The starting sequence number for the Requested Results.    It is a required argument if results are requested based on the input sequence number range.    It shall be a valid value > 0.  If 0, then fromTime and toTime are used.

ToSequenceNumber.description: The ending sequence number of the Requested Results.    It is a required argument if results are requested based on the input sequence number range.    It shall be a valid value > 0 and shall be >= fromSequenceNumber.  If 0, then fromTime and toTime are used.

FromTime.description: It is the start time for the Requested Results.    This argument is considered only when fromSequenceNumber and toSequenceNumber are set as 0.

ToTime.description: It is the end time for the Requested Results.    This argument is considered only when fromSequenceNumber and toSequenceNumber are set as 0.

RequestedMinimumDurationBetweenResults.description: The client can use this argument to configure a time interval between each Result to optimize the number of Results sent from the Server.    The Server can return the revised interval if the requested interval is not supported.    Note: It is only a requested minimum time interval by the client and the server could take additional time for processing.

RevisedMinimumDurationBetweenResults.description: It is the minimum revised interval supported by the server.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

MaxResults.description: It is the maximum results requested by the Client.    If 0, then the Server shall send all the unacknowledged results.

RequestedMinimumDurationBetweenResults.description: The client can use this argument to configure a time interval between each Result to optimize the number of Results sent from the Server.    The Server can return the revised interval if the requested interval is not supported.    Note: It is only a requested minimum time interval by the client and the server could take additional time for processing.

RevisedMinimumDurationBetweenResults.description: It is the minimum revised interval supported by the server.

UnacknowledgedResultCount.description: It is the total count of unacknowledged results in the server.

Status.description: It provides the status of the Method execution.

StatusMessage.description: It provides the high-level status information in a user-friendly text.

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

Comment.description: The comment to add to the condition.

Comment.description: The comment to add to the condition.

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

SubscriptionId.description: The identifier for the subscription to refresh.
The identifier for the subscription to refresh.

ResultEvaluationEnum.description: Indicates whether a result was in tolerance

Undefined.description: The evaluation of the result is unknown, for example because it failed

NotOK.description: The result is out of tolerance

NotDecidable.description: The decision is not possible due to measurement uncertainty.

Result.title: ResultDataType
Result.description: Contains fields that were created during the execution of a recipe.

ResultMetaData.title: ResultMetaDataType
ResultMetaData.description: Meta data of a result, describing the result.

ResultId.description: System-wide unique identifier, which is assigned by the system. This ID can be used for fetching exactly this result using the method GetResultById and it is identical to the ResultId of the ResultReadyEventType.  If the system does not manage resultIds, it should always be set to NA.

HasTransferableDataOnFile.description: Indicates that additional data for this result can be retrieved by temporary file transfer.  If not provided, it is assumed that no file is available.

IsPartial.description: Indicates whether the result is the partial result of a total result. When not all samples are finished yet the result is 'partial'.  If not provided, it is assumed to be a total result.

IsSimulated.description: Indicates whether the result was created in simulation mode.  Simulation mode implies that the result is only generated for testing purposes and not based on real production data.  If not provided, it is assumed to not be simulated.

ResultState.description: ResultState provides information about the current state of the process or measurement creating a result.  Applications may use negative values for application-specific states. All other values shall only be used as defined in the following:  0  Undefined initial value  1  Completed: Processing was carried out completely  2  Processing: Processing has not been finished yet  3  Aborted: Processing was stopped at some point before completion  4  Failed: Processing failed in some way

StepId.description: Identifies the step which produced the result.  Although the system-wide unique JobId would be sufficient to identify the job which the result belongs to, this makes for easier filtering without keeping track of JobIds.  This specification does not define how the stepId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client when starting an execution.

PartId.description: Identifies the part used to produce the result.  Although the system-wide unique JobId would be sufficient to identify the job which the result belongs to, this makes for easier filtering without keeping track of JobIds.  This specification does not define how the partId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client when starting the job.

ExternalRecipeId.description: External ID of the recipe in use which produced the result. The External ID is managed by the environment.  This specification does not define how the externalRecipeId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client.

InternalRecipeId.description: Internal ID of the recipe in use which produced the result. This ID is system-wide unique and it is assigned by the system.

ProductId.description: Identifies the product used to produce the result.  This specification does not define how the externalRecipeId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client.

ExternalConfigurationId.description: External ID of the Configuration in use while the result was produced.  It is managed by the Environment.  This specification does not define how the externalConfigurationId is transmitted to the system. Typically, it is provided by the client.

InternalConfigurationId.description: Internal ID of the Configuration in use while the result was produced. This ID is system-wide unique and it is assigned by the system.

JobId.description: Identifies the job which produced the result.  This ID is system-wide unique and it is assigned by the system.

CreationTime.description: CreationTime indicates the time when the result was created. Creation time on the measurement system (not the receive time of the server).  It is recommended to always provide the creationTime.

ProcessingTimes.title: ProcessingTimesDataType
ProcessingTimes.description: Contains measured times that were generated during the execution of a recipe.

StartTime.description: Contains the time when the system started execution of the recipe.

EndTime.description: Contains the time when the system finished (or stopped/aborted) execution of the recipe.

AcquisitionDuration.description: Time spent by the system acquiring data.

ProcessingDuration.description: Time spent by the system processing data.

ResultUri.description: Path to the actual measured result, managed external to the server.

ResultEvaluation.title: ResultEvaluationEnum
ResultEvaluation.description: The ResultEvaluation indicates whether the result was in tolerance.

ResultEvaluationCode.description: Vendor-specific code describing more details on resultEvaluation.

ResultEvaluationDetails.description: The optional EvaluationDetails provides high level status information in a user-friendly text. This can be left empty for successful operations.

FileFormat.description: The format in which the measurement results are available (e.g. QDAS, CSV, ) using the ResultTransfer Object. If multiple file formats are provided, the GenerateFileForRead of ResultTransfer should contain corresponding transferOptions, to select the file format. This specification does not define those transferOptions.

ResultContent.description: Abstract data type to be subtyped from to hold result data created by the selected recipe.

items.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

ResultEvaluationEnum.description: Indicates whether a result was in tolerance

Undefined.description: The evaluation of the result is unknown, for example because it failed

NotOK.description: The result is out of tolerance

NotDecidable.description: The decision is not possible due to measurement uncertainty.

ResultIds.description: List of result identifiers to be acknowledged.

ErrorPerResultId.description: Shall be null or empty if error equals 0. Shall have the same length as resultIds if error is not equal 0. Indicates for each resultId in resultIds, if the acknowledge was successful.  Per entry:  0  OK  Values > 0 are reserved for errors defined by this and future standards.  Values < 0 shall be used for application-specific errors.

Error.description: 0  OK  Values > 0 are reserved for errors defined by this and future standards.  Values < 0 shall be used for application-specific errors.  Shall be not equal 0 if any resultId of resultIds was not successfully acknowledged. Shall be 0 if all resultIds where acknowledged successful.

Timeout.description: With this argument the client can give a hint to the server how long it will need access to the result data.  A value > 0 indicates an estimated maximum time for processing the data in milliseconds.   A value = 0 indicates that the client will not need anything besides the data returned by the method call.  A value < 0 indicates that the client cannot give an estimate.  The client cannot rely on the data being available during the indicated time period. The argument is merely a hint allowing the server to optimize its resource management.

ResultHandle.description: The server shall return to each client requesting result data a system-wide unique handle identifying the result set / client combination. This handle should be used by the client to indicate to the server that the result data is no longer needed, allowing the server to optimize its resource handling.  If the instance of ResultManagementType does not support the ReleaseResultHandle Method, the resultHandle should always be set to 0.  If the error is set to a value other than 0, the resultHandle may be set to 0.

Filter.title: ContentFilter
Filter.description: Filter used to filter for specific results based on the meta data of the results. Valid BrowsePaths used in the filter can be built from the fields of the ResultReadyEventType, the ResultType VariableType or the ResultDataType or corresponding subtypes.

OrderedBy.description: An array of BrowsePaths (as array of QualifiedName) identifying the ordering criteria for the results. If the array is null or empty, no ordering is executed.  If several BrowsePaths are provided, the first entry in the array is used as first ordering criteria, etc.

MaxResults.description: Defines how many resultIds the Client wants to receive at most. If no maximum should be provided, it is set to 0.

Timeout.description: With this argument the client can give a hint to the server how long it will need access to the result data.  A value > 0 indicates an estimated maximum time for processing the data in milliseconds.   A value = 0 indicates that the client will not need anything besides the data returned by the method call.  A value < 0 indicates that the client cannot give an estimate.  The client cannot rely on the data being available during the indicated time period. The argument is merely a hint allowing the server to optimize its resource management.

ResultHandle.description: The server shall return to each client requesting result data a system-wide unique handle identifying the result set / client combination. This handle has to be used by the client to release the result set.  If the instance of ResultManagementType does not support the ReleaseResultHandle Method, the resultHandle should always be set to 0.  If the error is set to a value other than 0, the resultHandle may be set to 0.

ResultIdList.description: List of resultIds of results matching the Filter.

Error.description: 0  OK  Values > 0 are reserved for errors defined by this and future standards.  Values < 0 shall be used for application-specific errors.

ResultHandle.description: Handle returned by GetResultById or GetResultIdListFiltered, identifying the result set/client combination.

Error.description: 0  OK  Values > 0 are reserved for errors defined by this and future standards.  Values < 0 shall be used for application-specific errors.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

GenerateOptions.title: BaseResultTransferOptionsDataType
GenerateOptions.description: Abstract type containing information which file should be provided.

ResultId.description: The Id of the result to be transferred to the Clients

FileHandle.description: The FileHandle of the opened TransferFile.  The FileHandle can be used to access the TransferFile methods Read and Close.

CompletionStateMachine.description: If the creation of the file is completed asynchronously, the parameter returns the NodeId of the corresponding FileTransferStateMachineType Object.  If the creation of the file is already completed, the parameter is null.  If a FileTransferStateMachineType object NodeId is returned, the Read Method of the file fails until the TransferState changed to ReadTransfer.
